obfuscation: ﻿In the secondary school I hated English lessons .
original: ﻿In the secondary school I hated English lessons.

obfuscation: They were constantly the same ; glossary tests , reading a chapter aloud from the book and maybe some grammatics .
original: They were always the same; glossary tests, reading a chapter aloud from the book and maybe some grammatics.

obfuscation: Not arduous work actually , but I did n't like it anyway .
original: Not hard work actually, but I didn't like it anyway.

obfuscation: Sometimes we had to discuss openly in the classroom , and it was that part I did n't wish , almost hated .
original: Sometimes we had to discuss openly in the classroom, and it was that part I didn't like, almost hated.

obfuscation: y teacher in the 7 : th till 9 : th grade had made himself a very comfortable way to get off his teaching lightly .
original: y teacher in the 7:th till 9:th grade had made himself a very easy way to get off his teaching lightly.

obfuscation: Mostly he merely let us see some TV-programs in English .
original: Mostly he just let us see some TV-programs in English.

obfuscation: Preferably mister Bean .
original: Preferably Mr Bean.

obfuscation: possibly we did n't learn to much about grammar and so on , but who cared ?
original: Maybe we didn't learn to much about grammar and so on, but who cared?

obfuscation: We loved the English lessons , of course .
original: We loved the English lessons, of course.

obfuscation: It was n't until secondary school I noticed that my English were n't the better .
original: It wasn't until secondary school I noticed that my English weren't the best.

obfuscation: I felt ashamed and made n't wanted to speak or do anything that showed my lack of knowledge .
original: I felt ashamed and didn't wanted to speak or do anything that showed my lack of knowledge.

obfuscation: All tests turned away bad , and I who had very good grades in almost all of the other subjects found out that I strongly disliked English .
original: All tests turned out bad, and I who had very good grades in almost all of the other subjects found out that I strongly disliked English.

obfuscation: If you 're bad at something and make n't like it ( actually just because you 're bad in it , I suppose ) you wo n't improve , no matter how much your English teacher strains you and herself .
original: If you're bad at something and don't like it (actually just because you're bad in it, I suppose) you won't improve, no matter how much your English teacher strains you and herself.

obfuscation: She also taught Swedish , where I was one of the better , so she could n't understand why I was such a disaster in English .
original: She also taught Swedish, where I was one of the best, so she couldn't understand why I was such a disaster in English.

obfuscation: anyhow , I survived secondary school , consequently avoiding speaking and reading English unless I really had to .
original: Anyway, I survived secondary school, consequently avoiding speaking and reading English unless I really had to.

obfuscation: Right after school I went to study biology at the university .
original: Right after school I went to study biology at the university.

obfuscation: Suddenly every class book was written in English , and there were no way you could shirk .
original: Suddenly every course book was written in English, and there were no way you could shirk.

obfuscation: It was simple : if you did n't understood the English , you would n't understand the class which in turn meant a failed exam .
original: It was simple: if you didn't understood the English, you wouldn't understand the course which in turn meant a failed exam.

obfuscation: thus I had to deal with my dislike for English .
original: So I had to deal with my dislike for English.

obfuscation: My inaugural book `` Chemistry '' of a thousand pages ought to be finished within ten weeks .
original: My first book "Chemistry" of a thousand pages ought to be finished within ten weeks.

obfuscation: At inaugural I had to consult my dictionary for every second word , and it took me a very , very long time .
original: At first I had to consult my dictionary for every second word, and it took me a very, very long time.

obfuscation: After a while I learned that I did n't wanted to understand every single word .
original: After a while I learned that I didn't needed to understand every single word.

obfuscation: A few books by and by I found out that the English language was n't that bad after all .
original: A few books later I found out that the English language wasn't that bad after all.

obfuscation: Now , when I 'm in my third year and have a lot of books behind me the reading is n't any large problem any more .
original: Now, when I'm in my third year and have a lot of books behind me the reading isn't any big problem any more.

obfuscation: As I mentioned above , I never liked speaking English , I actually hated it in school .
original: As I mentioned above, I never liked speaking English, I really hated it in school.

obfuscation: But the university indirectly served me out here too .
original: But the university indirectly helped me out here too.

obfuscation: I met a couple of exchange-students .
original: I met a couple of exchange-students.

obfuscation: They were even worse in English than I was , but they did n't wish !
original: They were even worse in English than I was, but they didn't care!

obfuscation: They just carried on talking and if we Swedes did n't understood what they were saying , which happened frequently in the beginning , they merely tried with body language .
original: They just carried on talking and if we Swedes didn't understood what they were saying, which happened frequently in the beginning, they just tried with body language.

obfuscation: We all had a lot of fun , and at the same time I discovered that they did n't care at all about my bad grammar or if I pronounced something in an incorrect manner .
original: We all had a lot of fun, and at the same time I discovered that they didn't care at all about my bad grammar or if I pronounced something in an incorrect way.

obfuscation: They understood what I was saying anyway , and was pleased with it .
original: They understood what I was saying anyway, and was pleased with it.

obfuscation: That , I can tell you , was a relief !
original: That, I can tell you, was a relief!

obfuscation: The English language now began to interest me .
original: The English language now began to interest me.

obfuscation: I 've already discovered that I wanted to improve , but now I actually wanted to learn more and make improvements .
original: I've already discovered that I needed to improve, but now I actually wanted to learn more and make improvements.

obfuscation: The literature on the biology courses served me a lot with the understanding of texts , but they did n't taught grammar or pronunciation .
original: The literature on the biology courses helped me a lot with the understanding of texts, but they didn't taught grammar or pronunciation.

obfuscation: I decided to take this English class .
original: I decided to take this English course.

obfuscation: Listening is something I have n't prepared since school and I have always thought that I was bad at that too .
original: Listening is something I haven't trained since school and I have always thought that I was bad at that too.

obfuscation: But after visiting the first lectures I discovered that I actually - without problems - made understood what the lecturers were talking about .
original: But after visiting the first lectures I discovered that I actually - without problems - did understood what the lecturers were talking about.

obfuscation: The speaking is however my worst skill .
original: The speaking is still my worst skill.

obfuscation: I much feel uncomfortable and insecure .
original: I often feel uncomfortable and insecure.

obfuscation: But that 's what I 'm here for , to change it !
original: But that's what I'm here for, to change it!

obfuscation: I constantly liked writing - in Swedish of course .
original: I always liked writing - in Swedish of course.

obfuscation: It 's so easy in Swedish ; I have a feeling for which sentence that sounds right and which does n't , but in English I do n't get that little voice in my head .
original: It's so easy in Swedish; I have a feeling for which sentence that sounds right and which doesn't, but in English I don't have that little voice in my head.

obfuscation: I 've always found grammar very boring , and only remembered what I wanted a short while to pass the tests .
original: I've always found grammar very boring, and only remembered what I needed a short while to pass the tests.

obfuscation: That 's one of the things that I now regret .
original: That's one of the things that I now regret.

obfuscation: however I think it 's a lot of fun to create an essay .
original: Still I think it's a lot of fun to create an essay.
